pros: Positive people to work with.
cons: Not the best communication between professor and administration.

review_title: Great Benefits, Beautiful campus, Good people
pros: Free tuition after working 1 year, 1 meal a day at the Cafe, great groundskeeper, and even better staff to work with.
cons: no retirement, too few people in some departments, too many work studies doing professional work.

pros: - The people you work with are phenomenal - You get to make a positive impact on students - There is a good strategic vision for the university
cons: - Many staff and faculty felt overworked due to a recent reduction in force

pros: Admissions Director is a great leader
cons: n/a, leadership issues, culture is not the best

review_title: Great Part-time Job for College Student
job_title: Admissions Counselor Assistant in Redding, CA
pros:
- flexible hours
- on-campus
- great co-workers
cons:
- repetitive tasks
- not much autonomy given

review_title: Unkind and Poor Management of Employees
pros: Christian Values and some great people to work with as peers
cons: Poor current management, threatening to staff if they don't obey the leadership. Top leaders will use fear and intimidation strategies to attempt to get compliance of staff. They also mandate overtime without pay and are poorly organized. Then, they tend to blame the employees when things don't go well when in reality, it is their business strategies that are poor and not the fault of employees.

job_title: Director of Spiritual Formation in Redding, CA
pros:
My supervisor is great 
Student leaders are awesome
A great deal of influence 
God is there. Diversity is becoming more of a priority. It's a great place to bring about change.
Also, there is a lot of great people to work with...some of the greatest to be quite honest. You will fall in love with this place and this position. Simpson is definitely rising up into a new era and I believe the best is yet to come...it's just going to take the time that I, unfortunately, don't have.
cons: Even though they are coming out of it, Simpson is still financially in a hole. It's the same old, understaffed, and under-resourced scenario that leaves most staff burnt out. The new administration is progressive but still top-down and micro managey through pretty much the entire institution.

pros: Community is welcoming and supportive.
cons: Relatively poor pay scale for amount of work required.

pros: Good Christian environment and good place to work
cons: Often times not enough communication

review_title: Love working in Christian Higher Education
pros: Working in Christian Higher education allows me to share my faith and values with not only my co-workers but also our students.
cons: We are a university in a small rural town

review_title: At least you’ll have great colleagues!
job_title: Financial Aid Technician in Redding, CA
pros: Great staff in most departments, awesome students, and some excellent faculty.
cons: Some upper management lack empathy and concern for staff and faculty. Major budget deficit means frequent periods of layoffs and poor pay. Think of this job as a stepping stone — not a landing spot.

review_title: Simpson is a great place to get experience and make a name for yourself.
pros: Simpson University has a great sense of community, caring and understanding people. Everyone is very supportive. While working for Simpson you have the ability to take on a lot of responsibility and control your environment. Overall it's a great place to gain experience because there is so much that needs to be done. Simpson is also involved in the community and has a reputation for doing a lot for the community so you have the opportunity to really connect. Also, the benefits are fantastic, health care, insurance, lunches, retirement and discounts for your extending your education while you are there.
cons: Simpson University promotes a lot of people up into leadership positions. Which doesn't really seem like a great way of bringing in talent. It seems that the people really gifted at their job get the experience and reputations and then leave for higher paying jobs else where. Salaries are low at Simpson, depending on the position you have you can expect 15%-40% reduction in your salary. The leadership at times can be weak and indecisive while at other times making rash decisions without really thinking things through. Often time decisions were reactive versus proactive decisions that should have been anticipated.

pros: Dedicated staff and faculty, nice campus
cons: Leadership tends to micromanage; no room for advancement

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Redding, CA
pros: easy to work on your own schedule
cons: none at the moment. low retention rate.

job_title: Associate Professor of Theology in Redding, CA
pros: Small school where you get to do lots of different things.
cons: Financially fragile with problematic future

review_title: Students are great! It stops there.
pros: Nice office. Great students who really want to learn.
cons: After almost a decade in higher education, including the last six years at this institution, the pay is still half of what I make at the local community college. They do not pay you for your office hours, but Mandy that you hold them. They do not pay you for training, but highly suggest that you attend. Resources are limited, and professors are made to navigate things mostly on their own. The departments are small and there’s only three people in my department – and yet we are all basically still strangers. You do it for the students! You do it In the name of education! You do it because it’s what you chose to do with your profession. you won’t promote, you won’t get a flexible schedule, you won’t get a COLA increase like other institutions, you won’t get training with pay.

pros:
Co workers are friendly, and you may already know most of them, as they are fellow students
Job gives you a valuable insight into office work
You will be required to perform a variety of activities, so you learn in different areas
They are great about working around your school schedule
cons:
Staff is often ill prepared, or tells you what to do at the last min. 
Work can be very fast paced, and then slow down rapidly-unpredictable 
You are not allowed to say anything negative about the school, and must not tell people your true opinion of classes, professors, the cafeteria, etc

job_title: Accounting Specialist I in Redding, CA
pros: I have worked Simpson as a student and now has a graduate and they have always cared about not only my education but my life. The support the Simpson provides is unmeasurable. In all my positions I have had a great team who not only worked with me and cared what I have to say (even though I'm only entry level), but also never turn down an opportunity to teach me something new in my field.
cons: Some people don't feel the support as strongly as I do or that they are being heard, like all the schools and businesses.

review_title: A great school with a great heart in small town.
pros: Excellent faculty and staff. Everybody cares. Engaged student body. Beautiful surroundings. Great relationships among coworkers. Excellent classes and dedicated faculty.
cons: The setting: Small town setting (too small for some). Limited access to civic resources. Not a lot of good restaurants or other amenities nearby. Bethel students on campus.

pros: Challenges and lack of support bring employees together.
cons: Upper adminstration does not value employees or students. Employee attrition rates are high.

job_title: Student Caller/Alumni Relations in Redding, CA
pros: I've worked here for two years and I honestly love the loving body of the staff as well as the ability to grow spiritually as well as mature in the work place.
cons: I can honestly say I haven't had a bad experience here.

job_title: Tech Support/Systems Administrator in Redding, CA
pros: Location, people that care, and (assuming you share their values/goals), the mission of the school itself.
cons: Just not enough students = not enough money. Lots of turnover in leadership. Some culture issues common to stereotypical conservative/evangelical "Christian" organizations as known to North America.

review_title: Simpson a good place to work.
pros: The people who work there are friendly and there was some allowance for flexible scheduling..
cons: Pay is not competitive and there are not many opportunities for professional advancement.  Good place to get quality training for your next career.

pros: Great manager, great supervisors, great people in general. I worked with the buildings manager so  the time-flexibility was great.
cons: One can get frustrated with employees who don't meet the minimum standard of team work.

review_title: Good people but needs focused direction
pros: People, laid-back atmosphere, overall mission
cons: Extreme case of departmental silos, resource constrained, sense of territoriality that breeds a lack of collaboration.

job_title: Director of Conference Services in Redding, CA
pros: Positive and innovative with new campus feel.
cons: Rigid thinking at times. Ultra conservative.

job_title: Lead Web Developer in Medford, OR
pros: Great values and community as well as a positive work environment.
cons: They are a non-profit so personal advancement and salary suffer.
